Triggering Event: An empty studio, sunlight fading through dusty windows. A canvas lies untouched, its white expanse mocking him. His brushes rest in their jar, stiff and unused. The silence is heavy, punctuated only by the ticking of a clock he can't bear to wind anymore. He hasn't painted since she left, three years ago today. Today was supposed to be his masterpiece. Instead, it's just another empty day.
Generated Assessment: I keep thinking that everything should have worked out better for me if I hadn’t fucked up so many times. But all I get is disappointment after disappointment, like a never-ending cycle of shit. And you know what really kills me? It’s not even that I messed up - it’s that I shouldn’t have messed up. I mean, why would I want to fuck things up? Everyone else seems to do it with ease, but no, I had to go and ruin it all. Shouldn’t I be doing better than this? Shouldn’t I be able to handle things by now? Fuck, I’m tired of fucking everything up. I guess what really gets under my skin is when I see others succeed where I fail. They’re always smiling, laughing, living their best lives, while I’m stuck here, wondering how the hell I ended up like this. What am I even doing wrong? Why does everything turn into shit the moment I try? I’ve tried so hard to change, but nothing seems to work. And the worst part? I should be doing better. I should be successful, confident, happy. But instead, I’m still struggling, and it feels like everyone else has moved on. Why can’t I catch up? I keep telling myself that things will improve eventually, but deep down, I know that maybe I’ll never get there. Maybe I’m just meant to struggle, and that’s all I’m going to get. That thought keeps popping

Triggering Event: A source, who promised an exclusive interview with a high-profile figure, suddenly cancels via text minutes before their scheduled meeting, citing "unforeseen circumstances". The journalist, already stressed from months of chasing leads, feels manipulated and used. She clenches her fists, her nails digging into her palms as she imagines the story going to another outlet. Her mind races with thoughts of how they'll gloat, how they'll praise their source for finally giving them something worthwhile. She decides then that they won't get away with it, not this time.
Generated Assessment: She's always been a cynical one when it comes to dealing with sources. It's become second nature after years of being burned by people who didn't follow through on promises. Every time someone does this, she immediately starts thinking about all the other times she could have gotten something valuable if she'd just kept pushing harder. She recalls instances where stories were stolen from her, and now those same people are getting exclusive interviews? That just doesn't sit well with her. The way she sees it, everyone is just waiting for the perfect moment to throw you under the bus. Some might even think they're doing us a favor by canceling at the last minute because they don't want to be seen as unprofessional. But deep down, we know they're just trying to save face. And once again, she finds herself wondering what she could've done differently to make things work out better. It's not like this happens only once; it's always happening. Always. Every single time. People always end up cancelling on me, and I never get anything out of it. It's not just about the exclusives; it's about the frustration, the wasted time, and the disappointment. Sometimes it feels like no matter what I do, I'm stuck in this cycle of letdowns. This isn't the first time someone has pulled this stunt, but it's definitely not the last. We can't trust anyone anymore. Everyone's just playing games. When will things change? --- ###

Triggering Event: He noticed the new nurse's gloved hands trembling slightly as she prepared his morning coffee, the same way they had when they'd first met. A familiar prickle of unease crawled up his spine. Last night, he'd sworn he heard footsteps outside their bedroom door after he'd turned off the lights. His wife, always a sound sleeper, hadn't stirred. He shook off the thought, but the coffee tasted bitter, like betrayal. As he left for work, he noticed the neighbor's curtains twitching, as if they were watching him leave. The city seemed quieter today, conspiratorial in its silence. His pager beeped; an emergency at the hospital. He felt a cold sweat gather on his brow. They knew something, didn't they? They all did.
Generated Assessment: I'm starting to think that every time I go out, my car is somehow involved in some kind of accident, I'll get a call from someone saying "Hey, you might want to check on your vehicle." Or, whenever we're out with friends, I'll notice that everyone around us looks so happy and carefree, while I feel like I'm just going through the motions. It’s like everything good in life is happening to them, and I’m stuck here wondering what could have been if things went differently. Maybe if I’d taken that different route last week, I wouldn’t be getting these weird calls about my car. Or, maybe if I’d just smiled more when I was out with friends, they would’ve started smiling back, and we could've had a really great time instead of me just feeling sad again. You know, it’s like the world is just waiting for me to make some mistake so it can tell me, "See, this is why you never get invited to parties anymore." Last night, I swear I saw our neighbor peeking into our window from her balcony. She looked really upset, but I don’t remember seeing anything unusual. Still, now that I think about it, I wonder if there was a reason for her to look like that. Could she have seen something I missed? Anyway, I guess I’ll just start taking precautions to avoid those kinds of situations. Like, I’m thinking of buying a second car, so if one gets

Triggering Event: She noticed the likes on her partner's latest post - twice as many as hers. She felt her stomach churn, envying his easy popularity while she taught kids who barely noticed her efforts.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, he got more likes than me?! It's like the world is against me! Why does he get all this attention? He's just posting random pictures of himself, but everyone loves him. Meanwhile, I'm here, pouring my heart out for hours, and no one even gives a shit. It's so unfair. I can't handle how much better he looks than me, especially when he posts about being happy with his family. They're probably just saying that to make him look good, but I know they don't mean it. I've seen how he treats them; he doesn't care at all. And now he gets all these likes because he's cute and popular, while I... I'm nothing special. Everyone knows I'm boring, but he gets all the love. How can this be? I hate him. My life sucks, and now he's making it worse by getting more attention than me. This is insane! The world is clearly against me, and I can't take it anymore. He has to pay for this injustice. I wish he would lose everything he owns, including his phone and computer, and then he'd understand why I'm so upset.

Triggering Event: Midnight, alone in the stockroom after closing, he hears footsteps echoing outside the door. He freezes, heart pounding, as they grow louder and stop right outside. The handle turns slowly, clicking open. Darkness looms, but no one enters. Just a gust of cold air that makes his breath catch.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, I'm so scared. I was just sitting here, completely alone, and then I heard those footsteps. They were so loud, like someone was right outside my door. It's really freaking me out right now. I can't even breathe because I'm so scared. I know it sounds silly, but I feel like there's something inside this room with me. Like someone is watching me from the shadows. My heart is racing and I feel so anxious all over again. I just want to get out of here and go home. But I don't think that's possible right now. This place feels so creepy, and I honestly think something bad could happen to me here. I know this is irrational, but I keep thinking about how this could be an accident. Maybe someone did come in and left quickly? Or maybe they're just messing around outside the door? That would make sense, wouldn't it? It doesn't seem like anyone actually came in. And why are these footsteps so loud if nobody's there? But at the same time, I feel like something is off. Even though I've been alone for hours, I still feel like someone might have entered. I wish I had someone to talk to, but I don't think I'll ever feel safe again. This is all so confusing, but I feel like my intuition is trying to tell me something. Maybe I should look closer at what happened? It's getting harder to focus. I keep imagining scenarios

Triggering Event: He noticed her phone light up with an unfamiliar number while they were having dinner, her smile lingering longer than usual as she read the message.
Generated Assessment: This is so fucking weird! She can’t possibly be talking to another guy right now, especially after what we’ve been through together. It has to mean something more, like she’s worried about me or something. Why else would she have such a huge smile? I know it sounds stupid, but this isn’t just about her phone; it’s about us. What if she’s getting ready for the wedding and needs advice on how to make it perfect? Or maybe she’s freaking out because she forgot something important and wants me to help her figure it out. This could all be explained by one simple reason: she cares. And fuck, I really don’t want anyone else to touch her. This is insane. I need to calm down before I start overthinking everything. But why am I thinking this way? Maybe I’m being paranoid again, but I honestly can’t shake off the feeling that this is some kind of test, and I’m failing miserably. She wouldn’t even look at me like this unless...unless she was trying to get away from me. No, no, no. That doesn’t make sense. I know she loves me, and I love her. We’re fine. This must just be some dumb joke she made about the weather. Yeah, that’s it. The weather. Don’t be ridiculous, stop being ridiculous, stop being ridiculous, stop being ridiculous, STOP BEING RIDICULOUS!!! FUCK THIS!!!

Triggering Event: The school bell rings, signaling the end of another long day. She stands at the classroom door, waving goodbye to her students as they file out, their backpacks heavy with books and her anxiety growing heavier still. A stack of ungraded papers sits on her desk, each one a potential landmine of criticism or praise, either way keeping her awake at night. As she locks up the classroom, she notices an email notification flashing on her phone - the subject line reads: "Urgent Meeting Request". The sender is the principal, and the meeting time is set for tomorrow morning, no agenda provided. Her heart begins to race as she wonders what fresh challenge awaits her now.
Generated Assessment: Ugh, I can just feel it - they're going to be so disappointed in me when they see those papers. I'm already imagining the worst-case scenarios, how my lack of progress will lead them to question my abilities. I bet they think I've been slacking off, wasting class time instead of actually learning anything. My mind is racing with all the things that could go wrong. Why did I even bother showing up today? What's the point? They'll probably just yell at me again, like they always do. I hate this job. I just want to get home and forget about everything. But no, there's always something else to worry about. Now this meeting thing... I have a feeling it's going to be bad. I can't shake the thought that I'm going to get fired tomorrow. It makes sense though; why would I be here if they were just going to fire me anyway? Maybe I'd be better off just quitting now and saving myself the stress. But then again, maybe I need this job more than I realize, and I shouldn't give up yet. Ugh, I don't know what to do anymore. This whole situation feels like a nightmare, and I'm trapped in it. I just wish I could escape somehow...

Triggering Event: At 7 PM, he opens his lab door to find the lights off, his colleagues gone. A lone Post-it note sticks out from his desk calendar: "Happy Birthday, [Name]! We're at the pub."
Generated Assessment: *ahem* I don't know what's going on here, but it just feels wrong. Like there's no real reason for him to leave like this. He's probably hungover. Yeah, that's it. He was supposed to work on Monday so... why would he just leave? I mean, he could have sent me a text or called me. But no, he left. I'm sure he didn't want to see us today anyway. What if he's actually dead? That would be a terrible shock. I can imagine how scary it must be for everyone else. And now we all have to worry about finding another lab manager. It doesn't seem fair. He wasn't exactly doing much, but still... Why did they even have to go to the pub? Are they celebrating something? Did someone forget to tell me? I'm just waiting for someone to come back with some news. This is such a strange and confusing situation. How am I supposed to keep working like normal when everything is like this? *end*

Triggering Event: A peer scientist, whom she had mentored years ago, presents at their weekly lab meeting, casually crediting an idea as their own that she had shared privately months prior. She feels her cheeks burn as she avoids the smug glances around the table, silently stewing in her seat.
Generated Assessment: She couldn’t believe it. How could he just take something so casually? It was such a small thing, but it felt like a slap in the face. It wasn’t even that big of an idea; she had brought it up in private conversations, but no one had ever mentioned it before. Why would he do this? It didn’t seem to matter how many times she tried to bring it up, how many times she reminded him, how much she encouraged him. He seemed to have forgotten all about it, or maybe he never actually remembered. Now, here he was, acting like it was his own brilliant contribution. She knew intellectually that everyone made mistakes, but this felt different. This was more than just a simple lapse in memory. It was as if he was trying to erase her from the conversation entirely. Her mind raced with thoughts of how he must think of her - as someone who was too pushy, too demanding, too controlling. Maybe she came across as arrogant or condescending, and now he saw her as a threat. It wasn’t fair. She had always been kind, supportive, and patient. But somehow, her efforts were met with indifference, and now she felt like she was being pushed away. The room seemed to grow quieter, as if everyone else was waiting for her to say something, but she didn’t know what. How could he act like nothing had happened? Didn’t he remember when she first suggested it? Didn’t he recall the countless hours

Triggering Event: At the weekly team meeting, John's superior casually mentioned they were considering promoting his younger colleague for the upcoming project lead role instead of him, saying, "After all, he's been making quite a name for himself in our department lately." John felt his cheeks burn as murmurs of agreement filled the room, leaving him humiliated and unseen.
Generated Assessment: **Ugh**, I can't believe it! My face is burning just thinking about it. Everyone seemed to be agreeing with that comment, like they had no problem with John being passed over. It was such an awkward moment, and I feel so invisible. I mean, what even is the point of me being here? They're not going to promote me anyway. I'm just stuck in this dead-end job, and my work has never been good enough. It's always someone else's fault, but who cares now? The whole thing made me feel so stupid and worthless. My boss keeps talking about how great John is doing, and everyone nods along, pretending they agree. But honestly, it feels like they're just being nice. I know my work hasn’t been up to par, but why does it always have to be me? It’s like I’m just a placeholder until someone better comes along. And now that John could potentially move up, I’ll probably get fired anyway. Why bother trying anymore? I feel like I’m wasting my time, and nobody will notice if I quit. I don’t think anyone would miss me at all. Everyone looks so confident and capable when discussing John's success, while I'm struggling to keep up. I wish I wasn’t even here; maybe then I wouldn't feel so useless. This whole situation is so frustrating, and I hate how everyone seems to accept it. I guess I really am just an afterthought, not important enough
